title: How to Make a Chocolate Peanut Butter Parfait

steps.headline: Mix the peanut butter, cream cheese and powder sugar in a large mixing bowl.
steps.description: If possible, combine ingredients in a large Kitchen Aid mixer for a better blending result. Combine until the mixture is fully integrated and almost a crumbly consistency.

steps.headline: Fold in whipped cream.
steps.description: Forgo the mixer for this step and instead use a rubber spatula to integrate the cream into the peanut butter, powdered sugar and cream cheese combination. Mix well until the whipped cream has become part of the mixture.

steps.headline: Select serving dishes.
steps.description: You may want to use individual bowls or dishes to create your parfaits.

steps.headline: Drop one layer of crumbled graham crackers in the bottom of each dish.
steps.description: You want enough to create a “crust” along the bottom.

steps.headline: Plop in a few tablespoons of the peanut butter mixture.
steps.description: The size of your bowl or dish will generally determine how much peanut butter mixture you add. Add enough so you can layer each of the ingredients two times.

steps.headline: Add the chocolate mixture.
steps.description: Add the mixture after it has cooled and is no longer extremely hot; this will stop it from tainting any of the other ingredients.

steps.headline: Top with a dollop of whipped cream.
steps.description: This step is optional but can enhance the flavor of the chocolate and peanut butter combination.

steps.headline: Sprinkle more crumbled graham crackers over the top.
steps.description: Create a thin layer of graham crackers.

steps.headline: Repeat the process again until you’ve ended with a second dollop of whipped cream.
Top off with a graham cracker square or a piece of good chocolate sticking out of the middle.

text: Combine Thick Ingredients Mix the peanut butter, cream cheese and powder sugar in a large mixing bowl. If possible, combine ingredients in a large Kitchen Aid mixer for a better blending result. Combine until the mixture is fully integrated and almost a crumbly consistency. Fold in whipped cream. Forgo the mixer for this step and instead use a rubber spatula to integrate the cream into the peanut butter, powdered sugar and cream cheese combination. Mix well until the whipped cream has become part of the mixture. Create the Parfait Select serving dishes. You may want to use individual bowls or dishes to create your parfaits. Drop one layer of crumbled graham crackers in the bottom of each dish. You want enough to create a “crust” along the bottom. Plop in a few tablespoons of the peanut butter mixture. The size of your bowl or dish will generally determine how much peanut butter mixture you add. Add enough so you can layer each of the ingredients two times. Add the chocolate mixture. Add the mixture after it has cooled and is no longer extremely hot; this will stop it from tainting any of the other ingredients. Top with a dollop of whipped cream. This step is optional but can enhance the flavor of the chocolate and peanut butter combination. Sprinkle more crumbled graham crackers over the top. Create a thin layer of graham crackers. Repeat the process again until you’ve ended with a second dollop of whipped cream.  Top off with a graham cracker square or a piece of good chocolate sticking out of the middle.  Finished.
